name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Fredericksburg

reviews.text: We spent two nights and thought it was a great motel. It is very clean, the room was spacious with a king sized bed and a sofa. The breakfast offers gravy biscuits, hot waffles - you cook them, cereal, toast, and more. There is a nice exercise room and also a laundry room for guests. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Based on the price and the quality, I highly recommend the Fredricksburg. TX La Quinta
reviews.title: Very nice motel
Excellent value, comfortable room
reviews.text: The room was clean, comfortable, quiet and the bed very comfortable. The hotel seems to be fairly new and well cared for. The clerk recommended a restaurant, Andy's, and it was great and moderately priced. Breakfast was included with waffles, cereals, breads, and yogurt. We missed the eggs but there was plenty without them. We will definitely stay at this LaQuinta again when we go to Fredericksburg.

reviews.title: NOT truly pet friendly
reviews.text: My wife and I usually choose La Quinta Inns for their acceptance of larger dogs. However, this location will not allow dogs over 25 pounds, even service animals! If you have a service animal(of which most are over 25 lbs...) you will not be able to stay here. Its too bad they are not more flexible with special needs.

reviews.title: Customer service the way it is supposed to be...
reviews.text: Guest assistant at check in was very helpful, smiling, and pleasant. He showed awesome customer service skills. It is always a pleasure to see a staff who are passionate enough about their jobs to make sure the customer is comfortable and happy. Much appreciated!
Rooms were clean and comfortable. Pool and spa area were very nice and the frog pond in the corner was just adorable. Great stay!
reviews.title: Don't stay here! They overcharge you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel seems to be dated but it was clean. The price we paid seemed high, even though it was a Saturday night. Breakfast was ok, nothing really special but enough variety and the area was clean as well. Our bathroom door had one handle that was chrome and one was brass-colored, so it looked funny. I would think that if replacement handles are needed they would be matched to the opposite side, but this is just a small detail when the really important things like cleaning, comfortable beds, etc. are being taken care of. The front desk personnel were friendly.
reviews.title: Older hotel but clean

reviews.text: The person at the front desk of this hotel was by far the most rude front desk staff person I have ever encountered. I've been overseas and all around the States. Rolling her eyes, making me feel uncomfortable, asking why I would ever NOT want a second floor room at 11 am instead of waiting to come back after 3 pm when the normal check in starts, she SPRANG into high gear when I told her I had two dogs that were 50 lbs each. She couldn't wait to send me out the door. I don't know what kind of bad day this was for her but when I asked her if she was having a bad day, in a sing song voice said, "Oh I'm having a great day! And you?" I told her I was having a great day too. It was better because I ended up going to the Econolodge because they take pets. On this La Quinta's website, it says NOTHING about size and type of dog. Just "Pets Welcome". I reported her and this hotel to the customer complaint section of LaQuinta and am waiting to hear back from them. They need to video tape this hack and see just how crappy she treats paying customers. I would NEVER stay here, and I'm a member of LQ Travel Club.
reviews.title: Front desk hack

reviews.text: This is a good location for visiting Fredericksburg and Hill Country. Motel was conveniently located on US Hwy just east of Fredericksburg. Room was clean. well furnished and comfortable, as is typical with La Quinta. Breakfast was also standard fare for La Quinta, but area was kept clean and breakfast items well stocked. Wish they had an indoor pool. I have stayed here before, and will stay here again, as it is reliable.
reviews.title: Good hub for hill country visit
Holiday travel
reviews.text: This by far is the best LaQuinta I have stayed in. Room keys had been prepared in advance, so I didn't have to wait for them. Desk clerk was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast foods different than most hotels. Waffle station separated from other foods.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's nice they allow small dogs, but it's not dog friendly. There is a supposedly "designated" area for dogs but it's the one part of the property that doesn't have any grass and my dog got burs in her paws. There weren't any bags or trash cans for waste either.
reviews.title: Not dog friendly

reviews.text: We paid $151 for one night and it wasn't worth the money.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a good note, the rooms were clean, the staff were pleasant and very helpful, the pool area was very nice.
reviews.title: Good But Pricy For This Quality of Hotel

reviews.text: On a bad note..the mattresses were uncomfortable, the room was too warm, the internet in the media room kept closing the window out, security was lacking due to the back door being unlocked, and breakfast was poor...very few choices. We wouldn't stay again..even if the price was $99.
reviews.title: a little expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night while visiting Fredericksburg, and touring the Texas Wine Trail. This hotel is a couple miles away from the downtown historic area of Fredericksburg (not walking distance). Hotel looks fairly new, and every thing was modern and fresh. We found it to be a great base lockation for exploring the area. We were able to get a discounted military rate, and a surprise upgrade to a king suite. Room was very spacious, very clean, and bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly, and very helpful.
reviews.title: Nice base for The Texas Wine Trail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only complaint was that HBO was "out of order" during our stay, and breakfast was a bit of a dissappointment. Only hot choice for breakfast was a waffle station, and either the batter was not mixed properly or the heating element in the waffle iron is defective, because we could not get the waffles to cook all the way through - ended up doughy in the middle. Other than that, just standard continental breakfast items available.
reviews.title: Best of Fredericksburg

reviews.text: Overall, I would stay here again if ever in the area again. Great value for the area.
reviews.title: Clean room, no wifi in rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at the La Quinta Inn & Suites in Fredericksburg at the end of January (probably at the same time as a previous reviewer) and were very well satisfied. In previous visits to Fredericksburg, we had stayed in another chain hotel that purports to be pet-friendly. However, we found it overpriced and not very friendly. I was happy to find a La Quinta here, and our dog was more than satisfied. I was puzzled by the reviewer who said that there was "not a lot of open grass area," as we found the grassy areas more than ample for our dog's needs. There is a large grassy area in front of the hotel. In addition, there is a sidewalk lined with grass along the back street that leads to Wal-Mart, where there is more grassy space. Next to a lumberyard next door, there is an open field. (Even a horse would have been able to romp in all that space.) We used accumulated points to stay in a suite, which was immaculately clean, quiet, and very spacious. The bed was comfortable, and the bed linens and covering were not heavy, which is often a problem in some hotels. The desk staff was helpful and very friendly and seemed to genuinely like dogs. The wi-fi connection in our room worked as expected. Overall, this is a good value--a great stay when visiting Texas wine country.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

aka: La Quinta Inn And Suites Fredericksburg Hotel
